text: hello I'm David Pogue you know every
year at this time I write a special
column for The New York Times a
celebration of the ten best new features
of the year and every year this column
confuses some people they think I'm
writing about the ten best new products
of the year and I'm not these are the
best ten feature ideas of the year some
of which might even be in bad products
so this year I thought I would eliminate
all the confusion rather than just
writing about these great new ideas I
would show them to you thanks to my new
friends at CNBC roll the segment good
evening and welcome to the third annual
hogi awards I'm David Pogue your hosts
as you know the pogi award celebrates
technology innovation these are awarded
not to the best products in fact some of
the products are actually turkeys but to
the best features in products tiny
glimpse of greatness that somehow made
it through committee and out into the
marketplace and so without further ado
ladies and gentlemen the best tech ideas
of 2007 the envelope please thank you
Jim in the user interface category the
award goes for the first time to a
remote control it belongs to the Voodoo
box a four-hundred-dollar machine that
hooks up to your TV and gives you
instant access to five thousand movies
but the real breakthrough is this a
clickable scroll wheel on the remote the
wheel makes it simple to zoom through
the lists of movies and later simple to
rewind or fast-forward now that's
scrolling your way to genius
this year's communication category
winner is t-mobile's hot spot at home
cell phones these are special cell
phones that make unlimited free calls
whenever you're in a wireless hotspot
the best part you can walk out of a hot
spot and your call is seamlessly handed
off to the cellular network without a
hiccup next up the music category this
year's winner the I here safe ear but
these are twenty dollar earbuds designed
to replace the ones that came with your
ipod and why would you want to to
protect your kids hearing these earbuds
limit the volume 280 decimals that's 80
compared with the ipods usual top volume
of a hundred and your kids will hate you
for it until they're 40 next up the
software category this year's award goes
to google maps a very simple software
feature that makes a world of difference
it's great that google shows you how to
drive somewhere but what if you want to
avoid that traffic or just use a
shortcut you happen to know you just
drag the suggested route with your mouse
unbelievable and now ladies and
gentlemen the moment you've all been
waiting for the presentation of the pogi
ultimo the best single technology
feature of 2007 award goes to visual
voicemail on the iphone now on a normal
cell phone you check messages like this
you have seven new messages to use up
more airtime for no reason at all that's
nine but on this phone your messages are
listed as though in an email program you
tap one to play it david at that I need
the five hundred dollars congratulations
to all of this year's pogi award winners
and remember there may be drips of gravy
even in the lamest turkey
I'm here to code happy new year everyone
